newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Client orders boost Hungary's Pick.
newsitem.headline: Client orders boost Hungary's Pick.

text.p: An around three percent rise in early trading in shares of Hungarian meat processor Pick Szeged Rt was propelled by a few major client orders, traders said.
"Some bigger buyers appeared on the market, that seems to be the reason," one trader said, adding the supply side was weak. "There isn't any fresh news about the company."
At 1010 GMT Pick traded at 11,600 forints, up 400 from Thursday's close of 11,200.
Traders added a "buy" recommendation by Hungarian securities house New York Broker Budapest apparently contributed to a lesser extent.
"I doubt that Pick's rise stems from a buying recommendation by New York Broker Budapest," another trader said.
